prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician who Mr. Wright adopted when duty called.
Character 1
Name: Jinxie Tenma
Description: The maid of Kyubi Manor and a friend of Trucy. She thinks I'm a demon.
Character 2
Name: The Amazing Nine-Tails
Description: A masked wrestler of unknown identity and origin. The nine-tailed cape he sports is the signature piece of his costume.
Character 3
Name: Damian Tenma
Description: Jinxie's father and the mayor of Tenma Town. He was found unconscious at the scene of the crime.
Character 4
Name: Rex Kyubi
Description: The deceased alderman of Nine-Tails Vale. His snow-white hair was particularly striking.
Character 5
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She apparently studied psychology while she was in Europe!
Character 6
Name: Phineas Filch
Description: The caretaker of Kyubi Manor. He says he was guarding the entrance at the time of the murder.
Character 7
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective investigating the murder in Nine-Tails Vale. He's a self-styled champion of justice and keeper of the peace.
Character 8
Name: Florent L'Belle
Description: Mayor Tenma's aide. He was supposedly in the foyer with Filch at the time of the murder.
Character 9
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A brilliant former defense attorney who is supposed to be in retirement...
Character 10
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.
Evidence 1
Name: Yokai Legend Scroll
Description: A scroll depicting the demon Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox. [caption] Tenma Taro has black feathers, yellow talons. He does not wield any weapon. The sole document showing what Tenma Taro looks like. It seems those who foolishly choose to depict the demon are cursed.
Evidence 2
Name: Tenma Taro Warding Charm
Description: The Tenma Taro warding charm that Jinxie gave me when I set out for the scene of the crime.
Evidence 3
Name: Nine-Tails Flower
Description: A flower found only in Nine-Tails Vale. It boosts Jinxie's courage because it was her mother's favorite.
Evidence 4
Name: Special Edition Paper
Description: A newspaper with a photo of Tenma Taro soaring through the air.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Diagram
Description: A diagram showing the scene of the crime.
Evidence 6
Name: Foyer Diagram
Description: A diagram of the foyer, including the office used by the caretaker, Phineas Filch.
Evidence 7
Name: Fox and Demon Statue
Description: A statue that was at the crime scene. It depicts Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox locked in battle. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. The mayor's blood was found on it, but no fingerprints could be lifted. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. Wrapped in a large cloth. (2 pages.) A token of goodwill made in secret. Jinxie is now the only one who knows what the original looked like.
Neither of them are wearing gloves.
Evidence 8
Name: Golden Fur
Description: Some fur that was found at the scene of the crime. It's long and soft, and appears to be from some animal.
Evidence 9
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the Fox Chamber. There are bloody footprints and black feathers scattered on top of the blood. [caption] The man in a beige suit is lying on a table with a spear inpaling him. The other man in a green suit is sitting in a sofa with blood on his head. Neither of them are wearing gloves.
Evidence 10
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Mask
Description: A mask that washed up by the riverside. There's white hair inside. A mask found washed up by the riverside. It might have been at the crime scene. White hair inside.
Evidence 11
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Glossy
Description: A photo of the hero who sparked the monster craze and saved Nine-Tails Vale from becoming a ghost town.
Evidence 12
Name: Jinxie's Statement
Description: Jinxie's eyewitness account of the demon in the hallway near the crime scene. She says it fled toward the foyer.
Evidence 13
Name: TV Listings
Description: Filch's TV program guide. The afternoon wrestling match was a total disaster. [caption] At 3 PM, the program is "Temma Town Pro Wrestling". It is circled in red.
Evidence 14
Name: Kyubi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbed with a spear. Est. time of death: Around 3:20 PM. The victim had been in a drug-induced slumber.
Evidence 15
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: A threatening letter discovered in one of Alderman Kyubi's pockets. The threatening letter sent to the mayor. It's highly likely that it was L'Belle who took it from the mayor's briefcase.
Evidence 16
Name: Village Superstitions
Description: Superstitions that have been handed down generation to generation in Nine-Tails Vale.
Evidence 17
Name: Forbidden Chamber Key
Description: The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. No fingerprints could be lifted from it. The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. There's only one of its kind.
Evidence 18
Name: Couleur Me L'Belle!
Description: Hair color that washes out with water. It's Florent L'Belle's own brand and isn't available to the general public.
Evidence 19
Name: Hand Cream
Description: An item that was dropped in the Forbidden Chamber. It bears the "Je suis L'Belle" logo.
Evidence 20
Name: Forbidden Chamber Figure → Azuki Kozo Figure
Description: A figure that had been left inside the Tenma Taro statue. A thick layer of dust and dirt suggests it had been there for some time. A figure discovered inside the Tenma Taro statue. Apparently, it's something a certain thief leaves at the scene of a theft.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Alderman Kyubi was murdered with a spear that had been on the wall.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 1
Testimony: The fingerprints of the defendant, Damian Tenma, were found on the murder weapon.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 2
Testimony: At the time, Alderman Kyubi was asleep from a drug he unwittingly ingested.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 3
Testimony: Mayor Tenma attacked his helpless victim, impaling him like a human shish kebob!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 4
Testimony: But the sudden pain jolted the victim awake, and he grabbed a statue and struck back!
Person: Fulbright

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me go through each piece of evidence and testimony one by one.

First, I need to understand the case details. The victim is Alderman Kyubi, who was found dead in the Forbidden Chamber with a spear wound. The suspect is Mayor Tenma, who was found unconscious at the scene. The evidence includes a scroll depicting a demon and a fox, a crime scene diagram showing the mayor's blood on the spear, and a TV guide indicating a wrestling match at 3 PM. There's also testimony from Detective Fulbright claiming Mayor Tenma's fingerprints were on the murder weapon.

Looking at the evidence, I see the crime scene diagram shows the mayor's blood on the spear. The testimony from Fulbright says Mayor Tenma's fingerprints were on the spear. But the evidence says Mayor Tenma was found unconscious with blood on his head.

Wait, that doesn't add up. If the mayor was found unconscious, how could his fingerprints be on the spear? It seems contradictory because if he was unconscious, he couldn't have used the spear. So, the evidence about the mayor's fingerprints on the spear contradicts the testimony that he was found unconscious.

Another point is the crime scene diagram showing the mayor's blood on the spear. This conflicts with the testimony that the mayor's fingerprints were found on the spear. If the mayor was unconscious, he couldn't have held the spear.

So, the key contradiction is between the evidence showing the mayor's blood on the spear and the testimony claiming his fingerprints were on it. If he was unconscious, he couldn't have wielded the spear.

Thus, the conflicting evidence and testimony are:

{"evidence": 7, "testimony": 0}
</think>

cot:
Alright, I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let me start by understanding the evidence and testimonies provided.

Looking at the evidence, I see that the crime scene diagram shows the mayor lying on a table with a spear, and the alderman in a chair with blood on his head. The autopsy report says the alderman died from a spear wound. The mayor was found with no fingerprints on the spear, suggesting he might have used gloves.

The testimony claims that Mayor Tenma attacked the alderman with a spear, which was on the wall. However, the evidence shows that the mayor was found lying on a table with the spear, indicating he was the victim, not the attacker.

So, the evidence contradicts the testimony because the testimony accuses the mayor of the murder, but the evidence shows he was the victim.
</think>

cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by looking at all the evidence and testimonies provided.

First, I'll go through each piece of evidence and testimony one by one to understand what they say. 

Evidence 0: The attorney's badge, which is important for proving someone is a defense attorney. 
Evidence 1: A scroll depicting a demon and a fox. 
Evidence 2: A charm given by Jinxie. 
Evidence 3: A flower from Nine-Tails Vale. 
Evidence 4: A newspaper with a photo of a demon. 
Evidence 5: A diagram showing the crime scene. 
Evidence 6: A diagram of the foyer where Filch was guarding. 
Evidence 7: A statue used as a murder weapon. 
Evidence 8: Golden fur found at the scene. 
Evidence 9: A crime photo showing the scene. 
Evidence 10: A mask with white hair inside. 
Evidence 11: A photo of the hero, The Amazing Nine-Tails. 
Evidence 12: Jinxie's statement about seeing a demon. 
Evidence 13: TV listings showing a wrestling match. 
Evidence 14: The mayor's autopsy report. 
Evidence 15: A threatening letter in the mayor's pocket. 
Evidence 16: Superstitions from the village. 
Evidence 17: A key the mayor took from the killer. 
Evidence 18: Hair color used by Florent L'Belle. 
Evidence 19: Hand cream dropped in a chamber. 
Evidence 20: A figure left in a statue. 

Testimonies:
Testimony 0: Filch says he was guarding the entrance. 
Testimony 1: He claims to have seen nothing unusual. 
Testimony 2: He was in his office during the murder. 
Testimony 3: He didn't see anything suspicious. 

Now, I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. 

Looking at the evidence and testimonies, I notice that Filch's testimony says he was guarding the entrance and didn't see anything unusual. However, evidence 5 shows a crime scene diagram, which might suggest that Filch was not where he claimed to be. 

So, evidence 5 (crime scene diagram) and testimony 0 (Filch's claim of being in the foyer) contradict each other because the diagram shows the crime scene, implying Filch wasn't there. 

But wait, I need to make sure I'm interpreting this correctly. The crime scene diagram might show where the crime happened, which could be different from where Filch was. If Filch was in the foyer, but the crime scene is elsewhere, that could mean he wasn't guarding the entrance as he claimed. 

Another point is the TV listings showing a wrestling match at 3 PM, which Filch circled in red. If the crime happened around that time, Filch might have been distracted by the TV, contradicting his claim of being vigilant. 

Wait, the evidence 13 says the TV listings were circled in red, indicating Filch watched the wrestling match. If the crime happened during the match, Filch might have been distracted, contradicting his testimony of being vigilant. 

But I'm getting confused. Maybe I'm overcomplicating it. 

I think the main contradiction is between evidence 5 (crime scene diagram) and testimony 0 (Filch's claim of being at the entrance). If the diagram shows the crime happened elsewhere, Filch wasn't guarding the entrance as he said. 

So, the answer should be {"evidence": 5, "testimony": 0}.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's see what we have here.

First, I'll look at the evidence and testimonies provided. Evidence 5 is the Crime Scene Diagram, which shows where everything was at the crime scene. It mentions that the mayor was lying on a table with a spear impaling him and the alderman was sitting in a sofa with blood on his head. Neither of them were wearing gloves.

Now, looking at Testimony 0 from Filch, he says he was on guard duty in the foyer when the murder happened. He watched a pro wrestling match and heard some noise, but didn't see anything unusual. He also mentions that he was in his office when the murder occurred after 3 PM. 

Wait a minute, the crime scene diagram shows that neither the mayor nor the alderman were wearing gloves. But Filch's testimony says he was guarding the entrance and didn't see anything. If Filch was at the entrance, how could he not see the crime happening? The crime scene diagram suggests the crime happened elsewhere, possibly in another part of the manor where Filch wasn't guarding. So, this contradicts Filch's testimony because he claims he was guarding the entrance and didn't see anything, but the crime scene diagram shows the crime happened elsewhere.

So, the evidence (Crime Scene Diagram) and testimony (Filch's) contradict each other because Filch says he was guarding the entrance and didn't see the crime. The crime scene diagram shows the crime happened elsewhere, so Filch couldn't have seen it from the entrance.

I think the answer is that Evidence 5 and Testimony 0 contradict each other.
